SENT.plain: Complications in connection with operations also lead to the question of possible relations to the type of anaesthesia and their avoidability
The subject is treated demonstrating two cases of intracerebral haemorrhage and anterior spinal artery syndrome during and following catheter-epidural anaesthesia or spinal anaesthesia, respectively
No definite causal connection was established, even if the emergencies presumably would not have occurred without operation and anaesthesia
Complications are not completely avoidable, even if operation and anaesthesia as regards indication, execution and monitoring, are carried out correctly
